meanings.definition: Move smoothly and quietly with a gliding motion.
meanings.sent1: The cat slunk through the grass, trying to catch the bird.
meanings.sent2: She slunk out of the room before anyone noticed she was gone.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon slunk around the campsite, looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The shadows of the night slunk across the deserted street.
meanings.sent5: The thief slunk away into the darkness, carrying his loot.

meanings.sent1: The fox slunk into its den after a long day of hunting.
meanings.sent2: He slunk away from the scene of the crime, hoping not to be caught.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy slunk under the table with a stolen sock.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past slunk back into his mind, haunting him.
meanings.sent5: The defeated warrior slunk back to his village, his head hung low.
